page.title: Pronouns - Reciprocals
page.introduction: Reciprocals are similar to reflexives except that they only occur with plural subjects. They may be formed in the same way reflexives are, or they may be distinct. For example, in English, the reciprocal forms are phrases: each other and one another. Some languages use only a verbal affix to indicate reciprocal action of the plural subject, others have separate pronouns, others use a possessed noun phrase or a quantified noun phrase (as in English), and some do not mark reciprocal action at all.
